value.title: Tesla's Optimus robot is learning to navigate, sense and pick things up
value.excerpt: At Tesla's 2023 shareholders meeting, Elon Musk showed some new video of the Optimus robot he believes will represent the vast majority of the company's value in the future – as well as the method through which the development team is training the AI.

value.title: A third former Apple employee has been charged with stealing self-driving car tech
value.excerpt: A federal court in the Northern District of California has unsealed charges against Weibao Wang, a former Apple software engineer. Wang started working at the company in 2016 as part of a team that developed hardware and software for autonomous systems — technology that could conceivably wind up in self-driving cars.

value.title: Baidu exec charged with stealing Apple’s self-driving car tech
value.excerpt: A former Apple engineer and the executive at an electric vehicle startup owned by the Chinese tech giant Baidu has been charged with stealing Apple’s self-driving technology, as reported earlier by CNBC.

value.title: Self-driving Tesla doesn’t yield for pedestrian. Tesla fan cheers.
value.excerpt: A seven-second self-driving Tesla video posted to Twitter this past weekend shows a likely illegal driving event in San Francisco that, unfortunately, happens all the time in ordinary situations.

value.title: Apple engineer steals secrets on self-driving cars and flees to China, feds say
value.excerpt: He booked a one-way ticket to China and left the United States on the same night FBI agents searched his home, prosecutors say.

value.title: Tesla updates AI-trained robot army, takes new bots for a walk

value.title: Gimmick or innovation? Self-driving bus starts taking passengers in U.K. trial
value.excerpt: EDINBURGH, Scotland — Organizers are calling it a first for autonomous transportation: computer-driven buses operating on a real route with real passengers navigating through real traffic.

value.title: ChatGPT chief says artificial intelligence should be regulated by a U.S. or global agency
value.excerpt: The head of the artificial intelligence company that makes ChatGPT told Congress on Tuesday that government intervention will be critical to mitigating the risks of increasingly powerful AI systems.

value.title: Trying to make sense of artificial intelligence? Here’s your guide
value.excerpt: ChatGPT came on the scene as something different. Not only could it answer a seemingly unlimited number of questions, but it could also write screenplays, summarize huge amounts of information and imitate a human in conversation somewhat convincingly. It immediately seemed, at a minimum, that it could one day make everyday life more efficient.

value.title: Tesla’s “Full Self-Driving” sees pedestrian, chooses not to slow down
value.excerpt: But alarmingly, a video posted to Twitter over the weekend shows that although the Tesla system can see pedestrians crossing the road, a Tesla can choose not to stop or even slow down as it drives past.

value.title: World’s first self-driving bus rolls out in Scotland
value.excerpt: The world’s first self-driving bus rolled out in Scotland carrying passengers on a regularly scheduled route. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports on the future of public transport.

value.title: DUI suspect claims Tesla self-drive malfunction after Marin County crash
value.excerpt: A San Rafael man was arrested on allegations of intoxicated driving after crashing a Tesla into three parked vehicles, police said.
